methods.sort:
Sort the values in valuesToSort permuting the indexKeys chunk in the same way.

 The offsetsIn chunk is contains the offset of runs to sort in indexKeys; and the lengthsIn contains the length
 of the runs.  This allows the kernel to be used for a secondary column sort, chaining it together with fewer
 runs sorted on each pass.

Note: Java generics information - <ATTR extends io.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Any,
KEY_INDICES extends io.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Indices>

:param context: io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.sort.timsort.ObjectIntTimsortDescendingKernel.ObjectIntSortKernelContext<ATTR,KEY_INDICES>
:param indexKeys: io.deephaven.chunk.WritableIntChunk<KEY_INDICES>
:param valuesToSort: io.deephaven.chunk.WritableObjectChunk<java.lang.Object,ATTR>

text:
This implements a timsort kernel for Objects.

 https://bugs.python.org/file4451/timsort.txt and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timsort do a decent job of describing
 the algorithm.
